title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices reached a three-year high around $2,800 per tonne due to surging demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. Supply concerns stem from China's power shortages, environmental regulations, and unrest in Guinea affecting bauxite imports. The market shows a premium for low-carbon aluminum, reflecting growing demand for sustainable materials in clean energy sectors.

title: Aluminum Prices Surge Amid U.S. Government Reopening Hopes
summary: Aluminum prices on the London Metal Exchange surged 1.7% to $2,895 per ton, driven by optimism over a potential U.S. government reopening. This optimism has contributed to a rally in aluminum prices amid broader market dynamics.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit New Annual Highs; Market Expected to Stay Strong
summary: The aluminum benchmark price on SunSirs stood at RMB 21,920.00 per ton on November 17, marking new annual highs. The market is expected to remain strong amid ongoing supply constraints and demand pressures.

title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell slightly to $2,860 per tonne on November 14, down 0.67% from the previous day, after hitting a three-year high of $2,915 on November 3. Despite the pullback, prices remain elevated due to supply concerns and China's production limits.

title: The premium for aluminum in the US spot market has hit a record high
summary: Since June, the premium for aluminum in the US Midwest spot market surged to a record 88.10 cents per pound ($1,942 per ton) as of last Friday. This reflects tight supply conditions and strong demand in the region.

title: Chuangxin Industries IPO Gains Strong Investor Interest as Subscription Opens
summary: Chuangxin Industries, specializing in alumina refining and aluminum smelting, has opened its IPO subscription period. The company boasts a low-cost energy structure and high cost efficiency, with an annual designed production capacity of 788.1kt for electrolytic aluminum and 1,200kt for alumina. It plans to expand with a 500kt aluminum smelting facility in Saudi Arabia to leverage low-cost natural gas and strategic export routes.

title: The primary processing sector shows initial signs of marginal weakening; national aluminium ingot inventory buildup of 25,000 tonnes
summary: The primary aluminum processing sector is showing early signs of marginal weakening with a national aluminum ingot inventory increase of 25,000 tonnes. This suggests some softening in demand or production adjustments in the aluminum market.

title: A slide to USD 2,832.5/t & an 825t stock drop raise fresh questions for the LME aluminium prices
summary: Aluminum rod production is undergoing a wave of maintenance shutdowns affecting nearly 800,000 tonnes of capacity in November. This production cut wave is contributing to price volatility and raising questions about supply dynamics in the aluminum market.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit New Annual Highs; Market Expected to Remain Volatile at Elevated Levels in Q4
summary: Aluminum prices have reached new annual highs amid ongoing supply concerns and market volatility. The market is expected to remain volatile at elevated price levels through the fourth quarter of 2025.

title: Green aluminium could make EVs even cleaner for just €25 – study
summary: A study highlights the potential for green aluminum, produced with low-carbon methods, to significantly reduce emissions in electric vehicles by 2040. Europe’s cleaner electricity grid offers a competitive advantage for green aluminum production, which could add as little as €25 to the price of a car while cutting CO2 emissions equivalent to removing 900,000 fossil fuel cars from the road.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Global aluminum production generates approximately 1.1 billion tonnes of CO₂ equivalent emissions annually. Inert anode technology could eliminate 400-500 million tonnes of direct process emissions if it achieves 50% market penetration by 2040, representing one of the most significant decarbonization opportunities in heavy industry.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: The ELYSIS joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto successfully started up its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at a Rio Tinto smelter in Quebec, marking the first commercial-size implementation of this technology. The metal produced has approximately 40% lower carbon footprint than conventional low-carbon primary aluminum.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Pioneer Carbon-Free Aluminum in Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever unveiled the world's first consumer personal and home care packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum, featuring aerosol cans made from 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content. This collaboration demonstrates how companies across the value chain can accelerate low-carbon innovation.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining higher recycled content with low-carbon primary aluminum. This project represents both a packaging innovation and critical supply chain collaboration for decarbonizing the aluminum sector.

title: ELYSIS achieves breakthrough with commercial-size cell
summary: ELYSIS achieved a major technology milestone with the successful startup of its commercial-size inert anode cell, marking the first implementation of this technology at commercial scale and amperage. This represents a defining moment in the transition toward large-scale, low-carbon aluminum production.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China reached CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since the beginning of November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy that is reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% annually in October, marking the lowest output for the month since 2021, while steel exports declined 12.5% year-over-year to 978.2 million tonnes.

title: Nippon Steel to raise stainless steel prices again in November amid rising alloys costs
summary: Nippon Steel announced a further increase in prices for cold-rolled stainless steel flat products for November contracts due to higher alloy input costs. The announcement reflects ongoing pricing pressures in the stainless steel market.

title: Steel Holds November Pullback
summary: Steel rebar futures in China fell to around CNY 3,040 per tonne from a two-month high of CNY 3,120 on October 29th, pressured by lower demand and increasing trade protectionism from major Chinese trading partners. Steel exports from China declined 12.5% year-over-year.

title: HRC Steel Hits 31-week Low
summary: HRC Steel decreased to 789.00 USD/T, marking the lowest level since February 2025. Over the past 4 weeks, Hot-Rolled Coil Steel lost 1.48%, though it remains up 9.12% over the last 12 months.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News
summary: SteelRadar provides comprehensive coverage of global iron and steel exchanges with price indices and market analysis across Turkey, China, Europe, and North America for both 1-month and 2-month futures contracts.

title: Steel prices in the third week of November 2025
summary: The global steel market recorded mixed price movements during the third week of November 2025, with slight increases in some raw materials reflecting ongoing market volatility.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since November, as Beijing's anti-involution policy led to lower supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, the lowest for the month since 2021, and steel exports declined 12.5% due to protectionist policies abroad.

title: Middle East Iron and Steel Conference Highlights in Dubai
summary: The Middle East Iron and Steel 2025 Conference in Dubai highlighted major regional projects, including Algeria’s Tosyali working on green hydrogen-powered DRI operations. Steel demand in the Middle East is projected to reach 62.5 million tpy in 2026, with production expected to rise over 14% by 2027.

title: Steel News and Insights about Steel Market
summary: Recent updates include a 7.6% month-on-month drop in US rolled steel imports, a 5.4% year-on-year increase in Spain’s steel production, and a 5.8% year-on-year fall in global steel production in June. ArcelorMittal has suspended plans for a DRI plant in Dunkirk, and the EU hot-rolled coil market is stabilizing near its price bottom.

title: Rio Tinto Partners With Calix To Test Low-emissions Steel Making
summary: Rio Tinto has partnered with Calix to build the Zesty Green Iron Demonstration Plant, aiming to produce up to 30,000 tonnes per year of hydrogen direct reduced iron (H2-DRI) or HBI. The project is supported by a grant from the Australian Renewable Energy Agency and is part of efforts to decarbonize steel production.

title: World Steel News Standard
summary: Steel futures rose slightly on Friday due to signs of lower supply, while iron ore prices held steady and coking coal prices continued to fall. The market remains sensitive to supply-side developments and global demand trends.

title: World Steel Association Updates on Steel Production and Sustainability
summary: World crude steel production for September 2025 was 141.8 million tonnes, a 1.6% decrease from the previous year. The association released updated sustainability indicators and policy papers focusing on emissions reduction and capacity replacement in the steel industry.

title: Rio Tinto partners with Calix to test low-emissions steel making in Western Australia, pauses BioIron
summary: Rio Tinto has partnered with Calix to test the Zesty low-emissions steel-making technology in Western Australia, pausing its BioIron project for further development. The Zesty process uses electric heating and hydrogen reduction to produce reduced-emissions iron, compatible with lower-grade Pilbara ores.

title: From sewer to furnace: how wastewater sludge is greening steel production
summary: EU-funded researchers are converting wastewater sludge into biocoal and green hydrogen to help reduce the environmental impact of steel production. This innovative approach supports the industry’s shift toward more sustainable raw materials and processes.

title: Green Steel: Europe's Recycling Challenge In A World Of Tariffs And Cheap Imports
summary: Europe faces challenges in scaling green steel production due to global tariffs and competition from cheap imports. The article discusses the importance of recycling and policy support to advance sustainable steel technologies in the region.

title: Regesta Group sponsors Steel Budgets 2025
summary: The Steel Budgets 2025 event in Italy focuses on digitalization and sustainability in the steel industry, highlighting tools for monitoring sustainability data and ensuring compliance with European CO₂ emissions regulations. The event brings together industry leaders to discuss future trends and innovations.

title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cut Weakened, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Last Friday [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Copper prices fluctuated on Friday, closing lower at $10,824/mt on the LME, as expectations for a US Fed interest rate cut weakened and the dollar index rebounded. Spot prices in Shanghai showed a slight premium increase, while imported copper prices remained flat. Market sentiment was cautious due to ongoing divisions within the Fed and recent ethics issues.

title: Copper Price Gets Boost From Positive News
summary: COMEX copper futures settled at $3.74 per pound on November 17, with LME three-month copper also showing positive movement. The market received a boost from favorable news, reflecting ongoing strength in copper prices despite recent volatility.

title: White Cliff Minerals Danvers Copper Project Expansion
summary: White Cliff Minerals announced a major expansion at its Danvers copper project, with the mineralised strike length increasing by 153% to over 950 metres and confirmed continuity beyond 400 metres depth. New modelling shows thicker and higher-grade zones, indicating significant upside potential before formal resource re-estimation. The company plans systematic development milestones through 2025, including JORC resource estimation and expanded drilling campaigns.

title: Marimaca Copper's oxide project passes environmental hurdle
summary: Marimaca Copper's oxide deposit project received environmental approval, moving it closer to construction planned for the second half of 2026. The project aims to produce about 50,000 tonnes of copper cathodes annually over 13 years using an optimized heap-leach operation with minimal environmental impact. Additionally, drilling at the Pampa Medina satellite deposit shows promising high-grade copper continuity, supporting the company's long-term growth strategy.

title: USGS adds copper: American Pacific sees projects boost
summary: Copper was added to the U.S. Geological Survey's 2025 critical minerals list, highlighting its strategic importance for domestic supply chains. American Pacific Mining emphasized that this inclusion supports advancement of its copper projects in Montana and Alaska, with increased government focus on funding and permitting critical minerals projects. This move is expected to bolster investment and development of U.S. copper assets amid national security concerns.

title: Cyprium operations progress as copper redevelopment advances
summary: Cyprium Metals reported progress in its copper redevelopment operations, advancing its projects as part of ongoing efforts to increase copper production. The update highlights operational milestones and development activities aimed at enhancing copper output, reflecting positive momentum in the company's copper sector initiatives.

title: Los Andes Copper at 121 Mining Investment London
summary: Los Andes Copper Ltd. announced its participation in the 121 Mining Investment London event, showcasing its Vizcachitas Project in Chile. The company is focused on advancing this large copper-molybdenum porphyry deposit toward production, emphasizing its strategic location and infrastructure advantages. The event provides a platform to engage with investors and highlight the project's potential as one of the largest copper deposits in the Americas outside major company control.

title: Current Market Trends For Copper: 2025 Expert Insights
summary: The copper market in 2025 is driven by strong industrial demand linked to infrastructure modernization and the global green transition. Innovations in recycling technologies, including blockchain traceability and advanced hydrometallurgical processes, are enhancing copper recovery from e-waste, supporting sustainability and circular economy goals.

title: Copper: Wired for the Future
summary: Copper is critical to the clean energy transition, with demand projected to reach 61% by 2040 due to its use in renewables and electric vehicles. The sector faces supply challenges from declining ore quality and geopolitical risks, prompting increased investment in mining and infrastructure to meet rising demand and support sustainability.

title: Green Transition Ignites Demand While Supply Scarcity Fuels Volatility
summary: The accelerating green transition is driving copper demand sharply higher, with potential supply deficits forecasted up to 10 million tonnes annually by 2030. Innovations in sustainable mining, recycling, and efficient material use are critical to addressing supply constraints and supporting the energy transition's sustainability goals.

title: AI boom pushes copper toward a supply crunch, BNEF warns
summary: The rapid expansion of AI data centers is increasing copper demand by an estimated 400,000 tonnes annually, adding pressure to an already tight market impacted by energy transition projects and fragile mine supply. BloombergNEF forecasts copper prices could reach $13,500 per tonne by 2028, highlighting the need for innovation in supply and sustainability.

title: The Copper Initiative
summary: The Copper Initiative by CSIS focuses on securing critical copper supply chains to support national security, economic competitiveness, and energy resilience. It emphasizes policy solutions including strategic alliances, permitting reforms, and investment in production and refining to meet projected copper demand for technologies like AI and grid modernization sustainably.

title: Epiroc launches next-generation PCD drill bits
summary: Epiroc has introduced next-generation polycrystalline diamond (PCD) drill bits designed to significantly extend service life and reduce drilling costs. These innovations contribute to sustainability by minimizing downtime and improving drilling efficiency in mining operations, supporting the copper industry's productivity and environmental goals.

title: Nickel Prices Continued to Decline on November 17
summary: Nickel prices continued to decline on November 17, with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 118,700 yuan/mt, down 900 yuan/mt from the previous day. The market remains under pressure amid ongoing oversupply concerns and weak demand.

title: Nickel Price Hits 4-Year Low as Gloom Offsets Potential Indonesia Cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell to a four-year low on November 17, dropping 1.8% to $15,235 per ton on the LME, as weak global demand and a stronger US dollar outweighed hopes of supply cuts from Indonesia. The metal has declined about 8% this year due to oversupply and slowing EV sales.

title: The Monday Report - 17 November 2025
summary: Nickel prices dropped 1.17% on November 17, trading at $6.66 per pound, as part of a broader decline in industrial metals. The market was affected by a stronger dollar and weak manufacturing data from China.

title: Nickel Price Drops: A Temporary Setback or a Long-Term Trend?
summary: Nickel prices have recently declined due to market recalibrations and strategic decisions by global players, including liquidation of long positions and a stronger US dollar. Analysts expect oversupply to continue restraining prices in the near term.

title: SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review - November 17th
summary: On November 17, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price was 28,199 yuan/mt, with prices slightly declining amid sluggish trading. The market remains cautious due to ongoing supply-demand imbalances.

title: IWIP to invest $2 billion in renewables at Weda Bay nickel hub
summary: PT Indonesia Weda Bay Industrial Park (IWIP) announced a $2 billion investment in renewable energy at its Weda Bay nickel hub, aiming to accelerate the use of clean energy and support sustainable nickel production in Indonesia.

title: Mining with integrity to advance sustainable nickel downstreaming
summary: The article highlights efforts to promote sustainable nickel downstreaming in Indonesia, emphasizing responsible mining practices and the importance of integrity in advancing the country's nickel industry.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia has stopped approving new permits for nickel plants producing intermediate products like nickel pig iron and mixed hydroxide precipitate, pushing producers to add more value by processing further and addressing oversupply issues.

title: SMM #1 refined nickel price down on November 17
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price was reported at 116,500-120,900 yuan/mt on November 17, averaging 118,700 yuan/mt, a decrease of 900 yuan/mt from the previous day, reflecting continued downward pressure in the nickel market.

title: Sustainable Electrification Powered by Green Nickel
summary: Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Sustainable Materials developed a novel, carbon-free nickel extraction method using hydrogen plasma, reducing CO₂ emissions by about 84% and improving energy efficiency by up to 18%. This technology aims to revolutionize nickel production by enabling climate-neutral metallurgy and unlocking low-grade ore reserves with a significantly lower environmental footprint.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals' TECH Project aims to become a leading source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for lithium-ion batteries, supporting the global green transition. The project uses the environmentally friendly DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dam, and produces minimal waste, targeting carbon-negative and sustainable nickel production.

title: Canada's Nickel Processing Innovation for Clean Energy
summary: Canada is advancing nickel processing with innovations such as renewable energy integration, closed-loop water recycling systems, waste heat recovery, and carbon capture technologies. These efforts aim for net-zero or net-negative carbon emissions, improved energy efficiency, and sustainable resource utilization, supporting clean energy applications and strengthening supply chains for EV and battery manufacturers.

title: The Future of Nickel Alloy Innovations in Sustainable Manufacturing
summary: Nickel alloys are increasingly used in sustainable manufacturing, notably in EV batteries, aerospace, and marine equipment, improving battery performance and longevity while reducing environmental footprints. Advances in processing and recycling are producing lighter, stronger, and more corrosion-resistant alloys, helping industries meet sustainability goals without sacrificing efficiency.

title: Strengthen Indonesia's Global Nickel Leadership, PT Vale Indonesia and Huayou commits to climate-aligned technology pathways at COP30
summary: PT Vale Indonesia is implementing technological innovations such as heat recovery, off-gas utilization, electrification of processing, and CO2 solidification to reduce emissions by 33% and carbon intensity by 50% by 2030. These efforts support sustainable nickel production aligned with climate goals, enhancing operational efficiency and contributing to a cleaner nickel ecosystem.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, a leading Italian steel producer, has launched the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project at its Aosta plant. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane (AEM) electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of hydrogen annually, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and support sustainable steel production. The initiative is backed by €7.9 million in funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at its green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy. The facility is part of the company’s efforts to use electrolysis for producing green hydrogen, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and lowering emissions in steel manufacturing.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has begun the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project in Italy, aiming to cut carbon emissions in steel production. The project is highlighted as a significant step toward sustainable steelmaking in the country.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris S.A. announced the initiation of the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion Share Buyback Program, with a non-discretionary buyback agreement with a financial institution to purchase up to USD 600 million of shares starting November 3, 2025, and concluding by April 30, 2026. The shares purchased will eventually be canceled, and the program was authorized by a shareholder meeting held on May 6, 2025.

title: Italy - Factors to watch on November 17
summary: The Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris announced on Saturday the second tranche of a $1.2 billion buyback programme. This announcement highlights key market factors to monitor for Italy on November 17, 2025.

title: ITALIAN EXPERTISE FUELS PRYSMIAN INNOVATION
summary: Prysmian announced innovation initiatives as part of its 'Accelerating Growth' strategy, aiming to achieve over 55% growth targets. The announcement highlights Italian expertise driving Prysmian's innovation efforts in cable solutions.

title: Prysmian launches world-first 160 micron fibre
summary: Prysmian launched a world-first 160 micron fibre product, demonstrating continued innovation in cable and fibre technology. This development represents a significant advancement in the company's product portfolio.
